text:

How to stop a random ware attack on an old Android
text:
Years ago I was at those sights that well I should not have been on. Anytime my droid froze with a message something about paying…. I simply took the battery out. Waited a few minutes. Put the battery back in and…..went back to those websites.

Other times I would disable Jave.

Yes some websites didn’t work. But there are plenty that do.

Lastly i am still a baby when it comes to code. Pistons valves mechanical stuff I know.

But some day when I grow up. I’d have 3 servers.

The 1st can’t get on the internet. Even if Tom Cruise Ethan Hunt wanted to hack it. He can’t. There are no ports.

The 2nd Server is a middle man or woman. It is a virtual computer and a maze. When any corrupt covert code goes into this Server. That code will excite its intentions inside a virtual computer. The Server will watch the code. If the code does anything that is not exactly in line with what has programmed in the system. It gets quarantined.

See if Microsoft and Apple were smart-er………and the Feds were sneaker. They could fix their computers and the internet to pinpoint any hacker hacking anyone’s computer.

Even if the hacker is using every computer in every country. They will be found quickly.

All radios went digital years ago for a reason. But I’m just a wannabe know it all.

Finally the 3rd Server has nothing really on it. It is the go between. When you buy something from Microsoft. The order goes through tge 1st 2 servers in a particular way. And at a particular speed.

So if Macho Man Savage hacked my Servers. My little snitch would see Dana or data headed toward the door.

Or put another way. If a server - computer is designed so that data can speed up and go slow and go back and go forward and stop and or can’t flow freely at a high rate of speed out of any server.

If the hacker has not programmed in these variances. Then all of that data can’t leave server number 3

Jumping back in time. Garage door openers were great until someone invented devices that could steal your code out of the air.

Then be replayed to open your garage door.

So programmers created code jumping technologies. The codes change every time.

So even if you record the code going through the air it won’t open the garage door when it’s replayed.

** I’d like to ad just one other tip. Years ago when I was traveling. Sometimes I would get a pop up telling me that I was not on the internet while I was! In fact on the internet watching a movie.

In the past. I could eliminate this problem by removing the battery and waiting a few minutes. Then the pop up would be gone and all would be good.

I hope this helps. Oh I forgot! Apple and Android won’t let us remove our batteries any more.

WTF’

I guess once they make it. They don’t test it. To perfect it. They just make it and forget about it.

title: Show HN: Potash – Malware Proximity Search Engine
text: I wrote a search engine that ingests malware TLSH hashes from abuse.ch and provides a proximity search engine in order to find "close" malwares to yours. Comes handy if you want to classify a Malware that's not on VT or a malware that you only have the hash, but want to download a close enough sample. It works as a CLI app or a ReST API

title: Exploring the Intersection of AI and Physics: The Role of ChatGPT in Code Gen
Ask HN: Is being remote affecting your job search?
text:
For the last couple years good arguments were made to move to a lcol location and work remotely.

The golden ticket was to pull this off with a faang / faang adjacent company - make Bay Area SWE wages while living in Nashville.

Now that the job market has drastically changed, do you see living in these places where you have to primarily rely on remote work posing a challenge to finding work? Do people in the hcol tech hubs have a significant advantage or is remote work the new normal so the playing field is more or less level?

Interested to read your thoughts and experiences.
